column2:
Fully syncretised with the Indian religions, the reformed Sanamahist faith, now has a Holy Book known as the Puya, a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Sanamahism is an ancient religion orginating from Eastern India. Being an Indian folk religions, it draws a lot of element from Hinduism such as the three manifestations of God. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Low-tech non-pagans have very low Supply Limit in Pagan counties
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
§Y*§! The Sanamahist Pagan faith can be Reformed

Syncretised with Indian and Chinese religions, the reformed Bön faith with its history obscured, now has a Holy Book known as the Terma, a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy led by the Dalai Lama, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. In the game, Bön followers get a slight bonus to Martial and Learning. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a Dalai Lama, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Böns get a slight Martial and Learning bonuses
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The Dalai Lama can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Bönism is the religion of the peoples of Tibet. Considered to have orginated from Iran, shamanism and animism features prominently in the religion. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Low-tech non-pagans have very low Supply Limit in Pagan counties
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
§Y*§! The Bön Pagan faith can be Reformed
